channel.title: Ms1s on Masaki Iwabuchi
channel.description: Recent content in Ms1s on Masaki Iwabuchi

item.title: Biography
item.description: Biography 2018, Academic Work Masaki is an interaction and service designer based in NY. His work examines the reciprocal relationships between science, technology and their influence on human identity, subjectivity, and collective culture. He holds the MFA degree in Design and Technology at Parsons School of Design. Previously he worked at IBM for 10 years as a UX designer.

item.title: Interface Critique
item.description: Interface Critique Research | 2018, Academic Work I picked up an umbrella for critiquing as an interface. An umbrella or parasol is designed to protect a person against rain or sunlight. It is said that an umbrella has been used about 4000 years ago and remains in sculptures such as Egypt, Persia, and mural paintings. In many regions, umbrellas have developed to protect the king from sunlight, so they have long been a luxury item, a symbol of wealth and power.
